newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK to step up security at soccer game with Japan - TV.
newsitem.headline: HK to step up security at soccer game with Japan - TV.

text.p: Hong Kong police will step up security at a soccer match between Japanese and Hong Kong sides on Sunday because of a dispute over islands in the East China Sea, Hong Kong's TVB news said on Thursday.
TVB news quoted a senior officer as saying police would increase manpower at the Hong Kong stadium to prevent a possible flare-up of violence between Japanese and Hong Kong fans.
The officer also said they would segregate fans from the two sides.
Hong Kong police officials were not immediately available for comment.
Hong Kong's South China club and Japan's Grampus Eight meet on Sunday in the Asian Cup Winners' Cup.

Anti-Japanese sentiment in Hong Kong has flared in recent months after Japanese extremists erected a lighthouse and flags on the disputed islands, which Japan calls the Senkakus and which China claims as the Diaoyu isles.
Tension reached a new high last week when Hong Kong protest leader David Chan drowned after jumping off a ship in the area.
Japan has claimed the territory, a cluster of uninhabited rocky islets, since 1895. China has claimed them for centuries. Taiwan also lays claim to the territory.
